SENT.plain: We report a case of a 69-year-old white female who presented with a large left internal carotid artery occlusive stroke from a cardiogenic embolus
She was enrolled in an institutional study using a specially designed cooling helmet
Bilateral intracranial pressure (ICP) and temperature probes were placed to determine if there was any differential cooling and ICP compartmentalization between the two hemispheres
We demonstrated a significant temperature gradient between the infarcted and the non-infarcted hemisphere
A significant inter-hemispheric ICP gradient was also observed
We believe that this is the first demonstration of preferential cooling of the infarcted hemisphere over the non-infarcted hemisphere with regional surface hypothermia
